metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: In AWS, navigate to the Elastic Beanstalk application, as we did in the Choose Provider chapter, and click the "Create application" button:
content.html: In AWS, navigate to the Elastic Beanstalk application, as we did in the Choose Provider chapter, and click the "Create application" button:

content.text: Once you have clicked the "Create Application" button, you will be taken to this page, where you can give your Django project a name. I will name it "my-first-django":
content.html: Once you have clicked the "Create Application" button, you will be taken to this page, where you can give your Django project a name. I will name it "my-first-django":

content.text: Then scroll down until you see the "Platform" section, and choose "Python", with the recommended version:
content.html: Then scroll down until you see the "Platform" section, and choose "Python", with the recommended version:

content.text: Next, scroll down to the next section, the "Application code" section, and choose "Upload your code".
content.html: Next, scroll down to the next section, the "Application code" section, and choose "Upload your code".

content.text: Click on the "Choose file" button, navigate to the .zip file you created in the previous chapter and upload it:
content.html: Click on the "Choose file" button, navigate to the .zip file you created in the previous chapter and upload it:

content.text: The .zip file is uploaded, and we are ready to deploy!
content.html: The .zip file is uploaded, and we are ready to deploy!

content.text: Click the "Create application" button to start deploying.
content.html: Click the "Create application" button to start deploying.

content.text: The deployment will take a few minutes.
content.html: The deployment will take a few minutes.

content.text: Finally the project is live, and you can view it by clicking the link below the Myfirstdjango-env header, or type the host address in your browser:
content.html: Finally the project is live, and you can view it by clicking the link below the Myfirstdjango-env header, or type the host address in your browser:
